subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Why does 1 digital recorder capture EVP over another
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_0026_01C9F49E.7D10C170
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

A similar thing happened to me on our last investigation too.

  ----- Orig=
inal Message ----- 
  From: Zack Widup 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Se=
nt: Wednesday, June 24, 2009 7:19 AM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Why does 1 di=
gital recorder capture EVP over another






  There's another possibility=
: possibly the spirits involved only wish to impart sounds to a particular =
unit or units.

  I was surprised on one investigation I was on to get most=
ly all the same EVP on my DVR, which was hanging from my belt, and my camco=
rder, which was in front of my face. Other people on the investigation didn=
't get them at all. Go figure! 
  :-)

  Zack


  On Tue, Jun 23, 2009 at 3=
:26 PM, Rj <rasterer@...> wrote:




          There could be several=
 reasons, and it's only conjecture without comparing the two specific units=
 in questions.  But some ideas:

          1) The battery level on one is d=
ifferent than the other, and causing one to function less optimally and int=
roduce noise or artifacts into the stream.
          2) They were not actua=
lly 'sitting' side by side, but being swung around.
          3) They are p=
ointed at different areas
          4) One may be older than the other or h=
ave been dropped a few times.
          5) One may have been recently expos=
ed to extreme humidity or temperatures, while the other remained in a comfo=
rtable environment, before doing this recording
          6) One may be sit=
ting in a position more subject by airflow or vibrations
          7) They =
may use different memory cards. that have different error or accuracy profi=
les
          8) The final sound files may have been processed differently =
in various software programs
          9) People in the room may be nearer =
and moving closer to one than the other
          10) They may simply be tw=
o different models with different recording sensitives and limitations



 =
         --- On Tue, 6/23/09, lechevar2000 <lechevar@...> wrote:


=
            From: lechevar2000 <lechevar@...>
            Subject: =
[EVP-ITC] Why does 1 digital recorder capture EVP over another
            =
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
            Date: Tuesday, June 23, 2009, 5:57 =
AM 



            Hi, 
            I believe I saw an explaination on this=
 list about why if you have 2 recorders sitting side by side, why may one c=
apture an EVP on one and not the other? Someone was explaining about an ene=
rgy field like a bubble. 
            I'm trying to explain this theory to =
a friend. Can someone help me? 
            Thanks Laura


         






=
